R8.nl_constraint: A person should never be debarked in a same city more than once

children.nl_constraint: For any person and any city, the total number of times that person has been debarked in that city should never exceed one.

content.text:
<documents>
<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain zenotravel)
        ;(:requirements :typing :fluents)
        (:types
                locatable city - object
                aircraft person - locatable
        )
        (:predicates
                (located ?x - locatable ?c - city)
                (in ?p - person ?a - aircraft)
        )
        (:functions
                (fuel ?a - aircraft)
                (distance ?c1 - city ?c2 - city)
                (slow-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (fast-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (capacity ?a - aircraft)
                (total-fuel-used)
                (onboard ?a - aircraft)
                (zoom-limit ?a - aircraft)

                (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)
        )

        (:action board
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?p ?c)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (located ?p ?c))
                        (in ?p ?a)
                        (increase (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_board ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action debark
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (in ?p ?a)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (in ?p ?a))
                        (located ?p ?c)
                        (decrease (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_debark ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action flyslow
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a))))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total-fuel-used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyslow ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action flyfast
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (<= (onboard ?a) (zoom-limit ?a)))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total-fuel-used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyfast ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action refuel
                :parameters (?a - aircraft)
                :precondition (and (> (capacity ?a) (fuel ?a))

                )
                :effect (and (assign (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a))
                        (increase (n_refuel ?a) 1))
        )

)
</pddl_domain>
<pddl_problem>
(define (problem ZTRAVEL-3-10)
(:domain zenotravel)
(:objects
	plane1 - aircraft
	plane2 - aircraft
	plane3 - aircraft
	person1 - person
	person2 - person
	person3 - person
	person4 - person
	person5 - person
	person6 - person
	person7 - person
	person8 - person
	person9 - person
	person10 - person
	city0 - city
	city1 - city
	city2 - city
	city3 - city
	city4 - city
	city5 - city
	)
(:init
	(located plane1 city4)
	(= (capacity plane1) 2326)
	(= (fuel plane1) 205)
	(= (slow-burn plane1) 1)
	(= (fast-burn plane1) 2)
	(= (onboard plane1) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane1) 10)
	(located plane2 city2)
	(= (capacity plane2) 12132)
	(= (fuel plane2) 1469)
	(= (slow-burn plane2) 4)
	(= (fast-burn plane2) 9)
	(= (onboard plane2) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane2) 9)
	(located plane3 city3)
	(= (capacity plane3) 5204)
	(= (fuel plane3) 1532)
	(= (slow-burn plane3) 2)
	(= (fast-burn plane3) 7)
	(= (onboard plane3) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane3) 8)
	(located person1 city1)
	(located person2 city2)
	(located person3 city1)
	(located person4 city4)
	(located person5 city5)
	(located person6 city1)
	(located person7 city0)
	(located person8 city2)
	(located person9 city1)
	(located person10 city5)
	(= (distance city0 city0) 0)
	(= (distance city0 city1) 619)
	(= (distance city0 city2) 565)
	(= (distance city0 city3) 886)
	(= (distance city0 city4) 596)
	(= (distance city0 city5) 766)
	(= (distance city1 city0) 619)
	(= (distance city1 city1) 0)
	(= (distance city1 city2) 561)
	(= (distance city1 city3) 756)
	(= (distance city1 city4) 760)
	(= (distance city1 city5) 980)
	(= (distance city2 city0) 565)
	(= (distance city2 city1) 561)
	(= (distance city2 city2) 0)
	(= (distance city2 city3) 657)
	(= (distance city2 city4) 702)
	(= (distance city2 city5) 639)
	(= (distance city3 city0) 886)
	(= (distance city3 city1) 756)
	(= (distance city3 city2) 657)
	(= (distance city3 city3) 0)
	(= (distance city3 city4) 546)
	(= (distance city3 city5) 510)
	(= (distance city4 city0) 596)
	(= (distance city4 city1) 760)
	(= (distance city4 city2) 702)
	(= (distance city4 city3) 546)
	(= (distance city4 city4) 0)
	(= (distance city4 city5) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city0) 766)
	(= (distance city5 city1) 980)
	(= (distance city5 city2) 639)
	(= (distance city5 city3) 510)
	(= (distance city5 city4) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city5) 0)
	(= (total-fuel-used) 0)
)
(:goal (and
	(located plane1 city4)
	(located person1 city4)
	(located person2 city5)
	(located person3 city4)
	(located person4 city0)
	(located person5 city2)
	(located person6 city3)
	(located person8 city0)
	(located person9 city3)
	(located person10 city4)
	))

(:metric minimize (total-fuel-used))





)
</pddl_problem>
</documents> 

<information>
The user will give as input a natural language constraint that must be translated into PDDL3.0. The translation will be used by a PDDL planner.
</information>

<instructions> 
- Translate the input constraint into correct PDDL3.0.
- The resulting PDDL3.0 constraint must capture the same meaning as the initial input constraint.
- Remember that PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based. They can only refer to existing precates and fluents, thus, not to actions.
- Be sure to include temporal logic like operators in your translation.
- Format your answer such as there is no preambule and such that the PDDL translation is between the tags <pddl> and </pddl>.
</instructions>

<user_input>
For any person and any city, the total number of times that person has been debarked in that city should never exceed one.
</user_input>

Let me understand this constraint:

"For any person and any city, the total number of times that person has been debarked in that city should never exceed one."

This means that each person can only be debarked at most once in any given city throughout the entire execution.

Looking at the domain, I can see there's a function `(n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)` that tracks the number of times person ?p has been debarked from aircraft ?a in city ?c.

However, the constraint is about the total number of times a person has been debarked in a city, regardless of which aircraft. So I need to think about this differently.

Actually, looking more carefully at the function `(n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)`, this tracks debarkations of person ?p from aircraft ?a in city ?c. But the constraint is about the total number of times person ?p has been debarked in city ?c from ANY aircraft.

In PDDL3.0, I need to express this as a state-based constraint using the `always` temporal operator. The constraint should state that for any person ?p and any city ?c, the sum of all `(n_debark ?p ?a ?c)` over all aircraft ?a should never exceed 1.

Let me think about how to express this sum. In PDDL3.0, I can use arithmetic expressions. I need to sum over all aircraft for a given person and city.

Looking at the domain again, the objects include plane1, plane2, plane3 as aircraft. So for a person ?p and city ?c, I need to ensure:
(n_debark ?p plane1 ?c) + (n_debark ?p plane2 ?c) + (n_debark ?p plane3 ?c) <= 1

But this is specific to this problem instance. For a general constraint, I need to think differently.


I recognize the need for a more generalized approach that works across all possible aircraft. The solution requires a universal quantifier to create a flexible constraint that applies to any set of aircraft in the domain.

The key is to create a constraint that sums debarkations across all possible aircraft for a specific person and city, ensuring the total never exceeds one. This means no person can be debarked more than once in any single city, regardless of the aircraft involved.

The PDDL3.0 formulation needs careful construction to handle variable aircraft counts while maintaining the core logical requirement of unique city debarking.

I'll specify a constraint ensuring no person debarks more than once across all aircraft in any given city. The constraint uses forall quantification over persons and cities, summing debarkation counts to enforce the one-debarking rule.

The key is tracking each person's city debarking across multiple aircraft, preventing multiple disembarkations in the same location. By limiting the total debarkations to 1, I ensure precise movement tracking in the planning domain.

(define (domain zenotravel)
        ;(:requirements :typing :fluents)
        (:types
                locatable city - object
                aircraft person - locatable
        )
        (:predicates
                (located ?x - locatable ?c - city)
                (in ?p - person ?a - aircraft)
        )
        (:functions
                (fuel ?a - aircraft)
                (distance ?c1 - city ?c2 - city)
                (slow-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (fast-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (capacity ?a - aircraft)
                (total-fuel-used)
                (onboard ?a - aircraft)
                (zoom-limit ?a - aircraft)

                (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)
        )

        (:action board
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?p ?c)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (located ?p ?c))
                        (in ?p ?a)
                        (increase (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_board ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action debark
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (in ?p ?a)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (in ?p ?a))
                        (located ?p ?c)
                        (decrease (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_debark ?p ?a ?c) 1))

        (:action flyslow

                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a))))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))

                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))

                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyslow ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))

        (:action flyfast

                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (<= (onboard ?a) (zoom-limit ?a)))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)

                        (decrease

        (:action refuel
                :parameters (?a - aircraft)
                :precondition (and (> (capacity ?a) (fuel ?a))

                )
                :effect (and (assign (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a))
                        (increase (n_refuel ?a) 1))

)

<information>
The user will give as input a constraint in natural language. This constraint must be used as a transjectory hard constraint for the solution plan of the given the PDDL problem. 
</information>

<instructions> 
- Refine the user constraint to make it applicable to the given PDDL problem.
- You can rephrase and decompose the initial constraint into several other contraints.
- These constraints should be complementary and they will be later combined with AND operators.
- Constraints must be state-based and follow a Linear Temporal Logic. So constraints can't directly refer to actions.
- Avoid explicit PDDL language in your answer, the user can't understand PDDL.
- The set of all refined constraints must capture the meaning of the initial user constraint. 
- Format your answer as a clear and concise numbered list between the tags <constraints> and </constraints>. There should be no subitems, only the list of refined constraints.
- After, add 1 or 2 sentences to explain your choice of decomposition between the tags <explanation> and </explanation>.
- Here is an example of how to format your answer:
    <constraints>
        1. [natural_language_constraint_1]
        2. [natural_language_constraint_2]
        ...
    </constraints>
    <explanation>
        [consice_explanation]
    </explanation>
</instructions>

<user_input>
A person should never be debarked in a same city more than once
</user_input>

Let me analyze this constraint and the PDDL problem to understand what it means and how to refine it.

The user constraint is: "A person should never be debarked in a same city more than once"

Looking at the PDDL domain, I can see there's a `debark` action that moves a person from an aircraft to a city. The action has the effect of making the person `(located ?p ?c)` where ?p is the person and ?c is the city.

The constraint means that for any person, they should not be debarked (i.e., end up being located) in the same city more than once during the execution of the plan.

Looking at the domain, there's also a function `(n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)` which seems to count the number of times a person has been debarked from an aircraft in a specific city.

However, I need to think about this more carefully. The constraint is about state-based conditions, not actions directly. So I need to think about what states would violate this constraint.

Actually, let me reconsider. The constraint is about the number of times a person is debarked in the same city. Since this is about trajectory constraints and needs to be state-based, I need to think about how to express this in terms of states.

Looking at the domain again, there's a function `n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city` that gets incremented each time a person is debarked. This seems to track exactly what we need.

So the constraint should be: for any person p and city c, the value of n_debark(p, a, c) summed over all aircraft a should never exceed 1.

But wait, let me think about this more carefully. The function n_debark is specific to a person, aircraft, and city combination. So if person1 is debarked from plane1 in city1, that increments n_debark(person1, plane1, city1). 

I realize the complexity involves tracking multiple aircraft debarks in the same city. If the same person debarks from different planes in the same city, the tracking becomes nuanced. The total number of debarks for a person in a specific city needs careful consideration across all possible aircraft.

The key challenge is ensuring the constraint captures the total city-based debark count, not just per-aircraft debarks. I'll need a mechanism to aggregate these individual debark counts.

My focus narrows to the specific debark action, distinguishing it from initial city location. The constraint centers on preventing multiple debark events for a single person in one city, regardless of the aircraft involved.

I recognize this as a fundamental rule ensuring each person can only be debarked once per city location. The tracking mechanism uses the n_debark function, which increments with each debark action, providing a clear way to enforce this single-event limitation.

The core principle remains straightforward: a person cannot be debarked more than once in the same city across all possible aircraft movements.

This constraint provides a clean, unambiguous way to prevent redundant or impossible debark scenarios in the travel domain.

<constraints>
1. For any person and any city, the total number of times that person has been debarked in that city should never exceed one.
</constraints>

<explanation>
The original constraint directly translates to tracking debark occurrences per person-city combination. Since the domain tracks debark counts through numeric functions, this single constraint captures the complete requirement that no person should experience multiple debarking events in the same city throughout the plan execution.
</explanation>
